definitions: act of making something smaller or less in amount, degree, or size
examples: The store announced a price reduction on all items
Significant reduction in pollution levels was achieved

definitions: female dog or other canine animal
offensive term for a difficult or unpleasant person
examples: The bitch had a litter of six puppies
Our neighbor's bitch is expecting puppies soon
He complained about his bitch of a boss
Life can be a real bitch sometimes

definitions: activities, performances, or shows designed to amuse or interest people
examples: The hotel provides live entertainment every Friday night
Television remains a popular form of home entertainment

definitions: school or college for special training or education
society or organization of distinguished scholars or artists
examples: She enrolled in the police academy last year
The military academy trains future officers
The Academy of Sciences elected new members
He received an award from the film academy

definitions: small spoon used for stirring tea or coffee
unit of measurement equal to one-third of a tablespoon
examples: Stir your tea with a clean teaspoon
The drawer contains several silver teaspoons
Add two teaspoons of sugar to the mixture
The recipe calls for one teaspoon of vanilla

definitions: country, group, or person that cooperates with or helps another
examples: France has been a longtime ally of the United States
She found an unexpected ally in her supervisor

definitions: total number reached by counting
European nobleman with rank equivalent to British earl
examples: The final count showed two hundred attendees
Keep count of how many boxes arrive
The count owned vast estates in the countryside
She married a French count last summer

definitions: wide street in a town or city
way of approaching a problem or making progress
examples: Their office is on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan
Trees line both sides of the avenue
We need to explore every avenue for funding
This avenue of research shows great promise

definitions: person authorized to perform religious ceremonies and duties in Christian churches
examples: The priest delivered an inspiring sermon on Sunday
She consulted with her priest about the wedding

definitions: state of having paid work or the process of finding people to work
examples: Full employment remains an important economic goal
She found employment at a local hospital

definitions: low green plants with narrow leaves that cover the ground
examples: The grass needs cutting twice a week in summer
Children played on the soft grass

definitions: person who studies a subject in great detail, especially at a university
examples: The visiting scholar gave a lecture on ancient history
She's a respected Shakespeare scholar

definitions: particular version of a book, newspaper, or magazine published at one time
examples: The first edition of the book is very valuable
Today's edition contains breaking news

definitions: disease or condition caused by bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms entering the body
examples: The doctor prescribed antibiotics for the infection
Proper hygiene helps prevent infection

definitions: idea or plan put forward for consideration
examples: Thank you for your helpful suggestion about the project
The committee welcomed suggestions from all members

definitions: force that opposes or slows down motion
refusal to accept or comply with something
examples: Air resistance affects the speed of falling objects
The wire has low electrical resistance
The policy met with strong resistance from employees
Resistance to change is common in organizations

definitions: son of a king or queen
male ruler of a small state or territory
examples: The prince will inherit the throne someday
The young prince attended the ceremony
Monaco is ruled by a prince
The prince governs the small principality

definitions: disease or period of sickness affecting the body or mind
examples: She recovered from her illness after two weeks
Mental illness requires professional treatment

definitions: country with elected representatives and leader rather than a king or queen
examples: France became a republic after the revolution
The United States is a federal republic

definitions: person who does work without being paid, especially for charity
examples: The hospital needs more volunteers for the weekend shift
She works as a volunteer at the animal shelter

definitions: process of judging or calculating the quality, importance, or value of something
examples: Annual evaluation helps employees improve their performance
The property evaluation determined its market value

definitions: deep hole or tunnel dug to extract minerals or coal
bomb placed underground or underwater that explodes when disturbed
examples: Workers descended into the coal mine at dawn
The gold mine produced tons of ore annually
The ship struck a mine and sank quickly
Soldiers carefully removed mines from the field

definitions: color of the darkest shade, like night or coal
person belonging to a race with dark skin
examples: She wore a black dress to the formal event
The car's black paint gleamed in sunlight
The museum celebrates Black artists and their contributions
Black communities have rich cultural traditions

definitions: strong hard magnetic silver-gray metal used for making steel
heated tool for pressing clothes to remove wrinkles
examples: The gate was made of wrought iron
Iron ore is mined from the earth
She used the iron to press her shirt
The iron needs to cool before storage

definitions: small group of words that forms a meaningful unit within a sentence
examples: The phrase 'once upon a time' begins many fairy tales
Learn common phrases before traveling abroad

definitions: thing that is accepted as true without proof
examples: Your assumption about the cost was incorrect
We shouldn't make assumptions without checking facts

definitions: very small grains of rock found on beaches and in deserts
examples: Children built castles in the sand
Desert sand stretched for miles

definitions: person who plans how things will look or work, especially clothes, buildings, or products
examples: The fashion designer showed her new collection
They hired a designer to renovate their kitchen

definitions: process of making plans or arrangements for something to happen
examples: City planning requires considering future growth
Wedding planning can take months of preparation

definitions: particular way or method of doing something
setting or function on a machine or device
examples: Walking is her preferred mode of transportation
This mode of thinking leads to creative solutions
Switch the camera to portrait mode
The computer is in sleep mode

definitions: important or special event or ceremony
particular time when something happens
examples: Her wedding was a joyous occasion
We gathered for the special occasion
I've met him on several occasions
This occasion calls for celebration

definitions: organized series of events such as musical performances or films
examples: The music festival attracts thousands of visitors annually
They celebrate the harvest festival every autumn

definitions: soft flat hat with a peak
upper limit on something
examples: He wore a baseball cap to the game
The nurse adjusted her cap
The government set a cap on spending
There's a cap on class enrollment

definitions: set of moving parts in a machine that performs a task
method or process for achieving a result
examples: The clock's mechanism needs careful repair
Study the mechanism inside this device
We need a mechanism for resolving disputes
The pricing mechanism responds to demand

definitions: aim or plan of what someone intends to do
examples: Her intention is to finish school this year
He declared his intention to run for office

definitions: description of possible events or situation that might happen
examples: The worst-case scenario would be total system failure
Let's consider different scenarios before deciding

definitions: system or means of moving people or goods from place to place
examples: Public transportation reduces traffic congestion
The company arranges transportation for employees

definitions: deep round container used for cooking
container for growing plants
examples: Soup simmered in the large pot
She stirred the pot of boiling pasta
Plant the seeds in small pots first
The flower pot sits on the windowsill

definitions: man or boy with whom someone has a romantic relationship
examples: She introduced her boyfriend to her parents
Her boyfriend surprised her with flowers

definitions: careful thought about something
fact or detail to be considered when making a decision
examples: After much consideration, she accepted the job offer
The proposal deserves serious consideration
Cost is an important consideration in this project
Safety considerations influenced the design

definitions: period of life after stopping work, usually due to age
examples: He plans to travel during his retirement
She saved carefully for a comfortable retirement

definitions: thin cylinder of tobacco rolled in paper for smoking
examples: He quit smoking cigarettes last year
Cigarette prices increased due to new taxes

definitions: building where goods are manufactured or assembled by machines
examples: The factory produces thousands of cars each month
Workers protested outside the factory gates

definitions: small device for holding things together or attaching to something
short piece of film or video
examples: Use a paper clip to keep documents together
Her hair clip matched her dress
They watched a clip from the new movie
The news clip went viral online

definitions: imaginary or mythical being of great size
something or someone that is very large
examples: The fairy tale featured a friendly giant
Jack climbed the beanstalk to the giant's castle
The company is a giant in the tech industry
They built a giant statue in the park

definitions: person who is legally owned by another and forced to work without pay
examples: Slaves worked on plantations in harsh conditions
The museum exhibits detail the lives of slaves

definitions: person who believes in and follows the teachings of Jesus Christ
examples: Christians celebrate Easter as a holy day
The Christian community gathered for worship

definitions: feeling of surprise mixed with admiration
something that causes amazement or admiration
examples: Children watched the magic show with wonder
She gazed in wonder at the night sky
The ancient temple is a wonder to behold
Modern medicine works wonders

definitions: act of taking part in an activity or event
examples: Student participation in class discussions is encouraged
Your participation in the study is voluntary

definitions: small narrow river
continuous flow of something
examples: Fish swim in the clear mountain stream
We picnicked beside the babbling stream
A steady stream of visitors arrived all day
The stream of data never stops
